_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:32:05 using v2.7
title: Has the percentage of women who smoke at birth decreased?
analysis_commentary: The percentage of women who smoke at the time of birth has been decreasing since 2004/05 and approaching the 11% target for the end of 2015. In 2014/15, 11.4% of maternities had a woman known to be a smoker; this is a decrease of 5.5% from 2004/05. Department of Health's first integrated highly emotional smoking campaign was launched in 2003/04 and the decrease seen is linked with an increased government focus on reducing the number of people who smoke in England at this time.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Women's Smoking Status at Time of Delivery
